communication:
N. Peace Officer Standards and Training certification records
Georgia Peace Officer Standards and Training (POST) certification records
are subject to the Act's disclosure requirements after redaction of the
information cited above.35 However, the contents of POST applications,
except to the extent they include court proceedings, shall be considered as
confidential and shall be released only to the candidate or peace officer
to whom they pertain or to a law enforcement unit considering the candidate
or peace officer for employment.

Good Morning,

Your request has been marked as closed / completed

Thank you,

PO Anthony Fabian #10063
Chicago Police Department
Office of Legal Affairs

Dear Ms. Collins, 
We received your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated 13 May 2021, for any files concerning a business entity apparently known as "USAF II LLC," a hedge fund that controlled it called D.B. Zwirn & Co., and the U.S. Air Force. This would include memos, schedules, e-mails, depositions, reports, and investigative reports related to this entity, including those that would clarify the relationship between the US Air Force and "USAF II LLC." 
Due to our organization having a significant number of pending FOIA requests, we have been unable to process your request within the statutory 20 workdays.  To ensure all requesters are properly served in the order their requests were received, we have instituted multitrack processing of requests.  Based on the information you provided, we have placed your request in the complex track and have assigned FOIA Case Number 2021-02798-F to identify your request. 
Since it has been some time since your case was submitted, please provide us with the following information as to your desire going forward.   Please let us know if you still desire the records being requested or if you would like to withdraw your request.  We ask that you submit your desire by responding to this email not later than 7 June 2023.  If we do not receive your response by the above referenced date, your case will be “administratively closed, no fees assessed.”  Should your case be “administratively closed” you have the option to resubmit your request at a later date via the Public Access Link. 
Should you desire the FOIA Office to continue working your case, please note, currently, there are approximately 800 cases that will need to be processed ahead of your case to comply with 32 CFR, Part 286.8 subparagraph (a).  We will strive to provide an update between 90 and 120 days.  Our policy is to process requests within their respective tracks in the order in which they were received.  We do process each FOIA request as quickly as possible, however delayed responses can be expected. 
Should you need to contact us about your request, please do so via email saf.aa.haf.foia.workflow@us.af.mil Attention Ms. Janet Beasley.    Please ensure to reference your case number. 
 \\Signed\\ 
 HAF FOIA TEAM  SAF/AAII (FOIA)

Mr. Seitz,

This regards the FOIA request you sent to the Federal Aviation Administration on May 16, 2023.  I contacted Air Traffic Services and was informed the TFMS Repository dates back to January 1, 1998.  They would not have records dating back to 1983.  If you would like a formal no records found response letter, please reply to this email with that decision.  Or you may submit a new request to me for TFMS records for dates 1998 forward.

Thank you,

Judy Shipp
FOIA Management Specialist
817-222-5059

[AFN-3 Logo]

Good Morning Mr. Koebler,

The superior court is not in possession of any of the requested items.
The only documents we have, that are remotely associated, are with case # 23F055 which I have attached.
The Trinity Superior Court is not a county department, It may interest you to learn that the California Public Records Act (Gov. Code, § 6250 et seq.) does not apply to the court. (See id., § 6252(f)(1); Cal. Const., art. VI, § 4.) Instead, the public is entitled to have access to judicial administrative records under rule 10.500 of the California Rules of Court.

Sincerely,

Staci Holliday
Court Exectutive Officer
State of California
County of Trinity

SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA
IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OF TRINITY
DEPARTMENT TWO
THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA,
Plaintiff,
vs.
NHIA PAO YANG, DOB: 06/15/1959,
Defendant.
CASE NO.
COMPLAINT- Felony
The District Attorney of Trinity County, on information and belief, complains and
accuses defendant(s) of having committed, in the County of Trinity, State of California, the
crime(s) of:
COUNT ONE
RESISTING EXECUTIVE OFFICER, in violation of Section 69 of the California Penal Code,
a Felony.
Defendant(s) NHIA PAO YANG
On or about May 2, 2023, did unlawfully attempt by means of threats and violence to
deter and prevent Cory Persing, who was then and there an executive officer, from
performing a duty imposed upon such officer by law, and did knowingly resist by the use of
DAVID M. BRADY, State Bar No. 70246
Trinity County District Attorney
County of Trinity, Courthouse
P.O. Box 310
Weaverville, CA 96093
Telephone: (530) 623-1304
Attorney for the PEOPLE
DA CASE NO. 0033304

force and violence said executive officer in the performance of his/her duty.
COUNT TWO
RESISTING, DELAYING OR OBSTRUCTING A PUBLIC OFFICER, PEACE OFFICER OR
EMERGENCY MEDICAL TECHNICIAN, in violation of Section 148(A)(1) of the California
Penal Code, a Misdemeanor.
Defendant(s) NHIA PAO YANG
On or about May 2, 2023, willfully resisted, delayed, and/or obstructed , to wit: the
entry team, peace officers, in the discharge or attempted discharge of a duty of their office
or employment.
COUNT THREE
POSSESS DOGS WITH NO LICENSE, in violation of Section 6.04.060(B) of the Trinity
County Code, a Misdemeanor.
Defendant(s) NHIA PAO YANG
On or about May 2, 2023, did unlawfully own or possess a dog without a license.
COUNT FOUR
UNLAWFUL ATTACK OR INJURY, in violation of Section 6.04.050(D) of the Trinity County
Code, a Misdemeanor.
Defendant(s) NHIA PAO YANG
On or about May 2, 2023, who was the owner of a dog and/or dogs, did willfully and
unlawfully allow said dog(s) to attack or injure any person or animal.

COUNT FIVE
RABIES VACCINATIONS, in violation of Section 6.04.070(A) of the Trinity County Code, a
Misdemeanor.
Defendant(s) NHIA PAO YANG
On or about May 2, 2023, did unlawfully own, harbor, or have the care, custody, or
possession of a dog and/or dogs without possessing a current rabies vaccination.
COUNT SIX
UNLAWFUL DOG TETHERING, in violation of Section 122335(B) of the Health and Safety
Code, a Misdemeanor.
Defendant(s) NHIA PAO YANG
On or about May 2, 2023, did unlawfully tether, fasten, chain, tie, and restrain a dog
and unlawfully caused a dog to be tethered, fastened, chained, tied, and restrained to a dog
house, tree, fence, and a stationary object for an unreasonable period of time.
COUNT SEVEN
POSSESSION OF CANNABIS FOR SALE, in violation of Section 11359(B) of the Health
and Safety Code, a Misdemeanor.
Defendant(s) NHIA PAO YANG
On or about May 2, 2023, did unlawfully possess for purpose of sale cannabis.
PURSUANT TO CALIFORNIA PENAL CODE SECTION 1170(b)(2), the People of the
State of California allege the following underlying circumstances so that the defendant may
receive the aggravated term of imprisonment for any or all of the above applicable felony
offenses:

â California Rule of Court 4.421(a)(1) â The crime involved great violence, great bodily
harm, threat of great bodily harm, or other acts disclosing a high degree of cruelty,
viciousness or callousness.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(a)(2) â The defendant was armed with or used a weapon
at the time of the commission of the crime.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(a)(3) â The victim was particularly vulnerable.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(a)(4) â The defendant induced others to participate in
the commission of the crime or occupied a position of leadership or dominance of other
participants in its commission.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(a)(5) â The defendant induced a minor to commit or
assist in the commission of the crime.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(a)(6) â The defendant threatened witnesses, unlawfully
prevented or dissuaded witnesses from testifying, suborned perjury, or in other ways
illegally interfered with the judicial process.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(a)(7) â The defendantâs conviction for crimes in this
matter where consecutive sentences could have been imposed but the defendantâs
sentence was concurrent.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(a)(8) â The manner in which the crime was carried out
indicates planning, sophistication or professionalism.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(a)(9) â The crime involved an attempted or actual taking
or damage of great monetary value.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(a)(10) â The crime involved a large quantity of
contraband.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(a)(11) â The defendant took advantage of a position of
trust or confidence to commit the offense.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(b)(1) â The defendant has engaged in violent conduct
which indicates a serious danger to society.

â California Rule of Court 4.421(b)(2) â The defendantâs prior convictions as an adult, or
sustained petitions in juvenile delinquency proceedings, are numerous or of increasing
seriousness.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(b)(3) â The defendant has served a prior prison term.

â California Rule of Court 4.421(b)(5) â The defendantâs prior performance on probation

harmful matter to induce, persuade, or encourage the minor to engage in lewd or lascivious

â California Rule of Court 4.421(c)/Penal Code section 1170.74 â The defendant
violated section 11377, 11378, 11379 or 11379.6 of the California Health and Safety Code,
involving methamphetamine in the crystal form.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(c)/Penal Code section 1170.75 â The felony was
committed because of the victimâs race, color, religion, nationality, country of origin, ancestry
or sexual orientation.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(c)/Penal Code section 1170.8 â Arson, robbery, or
assault occurred in or to a place of worship.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(c)/Penal Code section 1170.81 â The crime committed
was a life term crime on a peace officer victim.
â California Rule of Court 4.421(c)/Penal Code section 1170.84 â The crime was a
serious felony under section 1192.7(c) of the California Penal Code and the defendant
engaged in the tying, binding or confining of any victim.

communication: Flynn, Andrew J would like to recall the message, "NSA FOIA Request 116287".

Hello!

This is a test email to verify the above email address to make sure is a
good one to use in a FOIA response.

Please, let me know.

V/r


Raul A. Roman Beltran
FOIA Analyst
Defense Contract Management Agency
Strategic and Communication Division, DCMA-DCC
3901 A Avenue, Building 10500
Fort Gregg-Adams, VA  23801
Government Cell Phone: 804.402-0722
 
 
Confidentiality Notice: This e-mail may contain CONTROLLED UNCLASSIFIED
INFORMATION in the form of FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY, unclassified information
that may be withheld from the public because disclosure would cause
foreseeable harm to an interest protected by one or more of the Freedom of
Information Act (FOIA) Exemptions 2 through 9 identified in 5 USC 552(b).
This message may contain PERSONALLY IDENTIFIABLE INFORMATION, protected by
the PRIVACY ACT OF 1974.  Access to this e-mail by anyone other than the
intended addressee is unauthorized and may be unlawful.  If you are not the
intended recipient of this message, any review, disclosure, copying,
distribution, or retention of the same is strictly prohibited and also may
violate statutory and regulatory requirements.  If you are not the intended
recipient, please immediately notify the sender. Do not forward this message
or any attachments without express permission of the sender.
foia_case_officer would like to recall the message, "NSA FOIA Request 116287".

Mr. Hoover,

Due to the size and number of custodians of your requests, as the coordinator I have been unable to determine the exact associated fees. Yet, I am submitting the below as estimated cost subject to be modified once all documentation has been compiled and submitted.

In accordance with Policy<chrome-extension://efaidnbmnnnibpcajpcglclefindmkaj/https:/andersoncountytn.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/Anderson-County-Public-Records-Policy.pdf> stated below and subject to your prior waiver of inspection of records, the cost associated with the electronic copies reimbursement of a thumb drive is $2.70 per drive. Additionally, the current associated cost for retrieving, redacting, etc. is $122, which is subject to increase based upon the remaining custodian’s submission of time spent compiling. If you request the thumb drive(s) be mailed to your Kingston Springs, TN address rather than retrieving in person, you are also required to cover the cost of shipping. Once the exact amount can be determined, I will notify a detailed cost amount. If electing to receive the data via United States Postal Service, we will mail the thumb drive(s) once the check payment has been received.

[cid:image005.jpg@01D98E20.CED9ACD0]
[cid:image007.jpg@01D98E20.CED9ACD0]

This Office is moving forward with your request and will contact you on or around May 30th to discuss the process you wish to move forward with in receiving your requested documentation.

Feel free to contact me if you have further questions or concerns before then.

Sincerely,
Kim

Kim Jeffers-Whitaker, SCP
Director of Human Resource & Risk Management
Anderson County Government
100 N Main St., Room 102
Clinton, TN 37716
Main Tel 865.264.6300<tel:865.264.6300>  |  Direct 865.264.6330<tel:865.264.6330>  |  Fax 865.264.6259<tel:865.264.6259>  |  Cell 865.363.6321
kwhitaker@andersoncountytn.gov<mailto:kwhitaker@andersoncountytn.govorg> | Website<https://andersoncountytn.gov/humanresources/> | Facebook<https://www.facebook.com/HRRMofACG/>

In every crisis, doubt or confusion, take the higher path - the path of compassion, courage ~ Amit Ray, Author

Confidentiality Note: The information contained in this e-mail transmission is privileged and confidential and is intended only for the recipient(s) named above. If the reader of this message is not the recipient(s) named above or an authorized agent of such recipient(s) responsible for delivering it to the intended recipient(s), you are hereby notified that you have received this e-mail in error, and that any review, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this transmission (including any attachments) is strictly prohibited. If you have received this e-mail in error, please notify the sender immediately by e-mail reply. Thank you!

Dear Matthew,

Per your request of May 22, 2023, I have updated your FOIA request, FOIA
tracking number *RD 77093*, to reflect that you narrowed your request to
FBI case file *100-MI-15812 *(I have also removed FBI case
file 100A-BA-25222 from your request). Since your request does not exceed
700 pages, I have reassigned it to our *first-tier processing queue*.
Taking into consideration our existing backlog, we *estimate* it will take*
39 months* to complete processing.

Records transferred to the custody of the National Archives are exempt from
the fee and fee waiver provisions of the Freedom of Information Act because
a fee schedule was in effect prior to enactment. The applicable section
states that “nothing in this subparagraph shall supersede fees chargeable
under a statute specifically providing for setting the level of fees for
particular types of records” (5 U.S.C. 552 (a)(4)(A)(vi)). The relevant fee
statute authorizes the National Archives “to charge a fee for making or
authenticating copies or reproductions of materials transferred to the
Archivist’s custody.” (44 U.S.C. 2116(c)). The inability to grant the
requested fee waiver does not constitute a denial under the terms of the
Freedom of Information Act.


In the future, someone from our office will contact you to inform you that
a line-by-line review of the case file has been completed. At that point,
you will have the option to order a copy for a fee of 80 cents per page or
view the record in-person.


If you visit the National Archives at College Park, Maryland, we will save
a digital surrogate of the original record (this will be the reviewed copy
that may include redactions) to a CD and you will be able to view the file*
at no cost*. If you need to use one of our public access computers you will
need to bring a universal serial bus (USB) drive so that you will be able
to download a copy. You also have the option of bringing your own personal
laptop that has a CD-Drive in order to copy the file(s) that way.


Sincerely,

REBECCA SHARP
Archivist
Special Access and FOIA Program (RF)
National Archives and Records Administration

8601 Adelphi Road

College Park, MD 20740-6001

(301) 837-0372

rebecca.sharp@nara.gov
www.archives.gov/research/foia/
